ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Functional auditory processing deficits
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant deficits in auditory closure, figure-ground discrimination, and temporal patterning (labeling) compared to baseline tasks, consistent with TBI sequelae.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Asymmetrical mild-to-moderate SNHL at 3000–8000 Hz, likely associated with temporal bone trauma from the accident.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cognitive and language deficits
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Documented history of TBI with deficits in attention, tracking, and word-finding which contribute to poor performance on complex auditory tasks.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess peripheral hearing sensitivity following TBI and reported hearing difficulties.
To evaluate word recognition abilities and cross-check pure-tone thresholds.
To assess middle ear function and integrity of the acoustic reflex arc.
To evaluate cochlear outer hair cell function and neural integrity (ABR/ALLR) given the history of TBI.
Behavioral CAP test to assess auditory closure.
Behavioral CAP test to assess figure-ground discrimination (binaural separation).
Behavioral CAP test to assess binaural integration.
Behavioral CAP test to assess temporal patterning and interhemispheric transfer.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Standard audiological assessment revealed bilateral asymmetrical mild-to-moderate high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss, consistent with the history of trauma. Peripheral function was otherwise intact (normal tympanometry, OAEs present to 3 kHz). Electrophysiology showed normal ABR but abnormally large amplitude on ALLR, suggestive of cortical disinhibition.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral asymmetrical mild-to-moderate SNHL at 3000–8000 Hz; poorer in the left ear. Low and mid-frequencies within normal limits.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Word recognition scores consistent with pure-tone thresholds (Right 91%, Left 87% at 50 dB HL).

tests.name: Tympanometry & Reflexes
tests.result_summary: Type A tympanograms bilaterally. Reflexes present except at 4000 Hz (consistent with HL).

tests.name: OAEs & Electrophysiology
tests.result_summary: TEOAEs/DPOAEs present to 3000 Hz. ABR normal. ALLR showed normal latency but abnormally large amplitude.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Behavioral CAP assessment demonstrated significant functional deficits. Performance dropped drastically on filtered speech, competing sentences, and linguistic labeling of frequency patterns compared to non-challenging baseline conditions (unfiltered, monotic, humming). Interestingly, dichotic digit performance was poor but did not differ from the monotic condition.

tests.name: Low-Pass Filtered Speech (LPFS)
tests.result_summary: Performance dropped >60% in filtered condition compared to unfiltered; scores well below normal limits.

tests.name: Competing Sentences (CS)
tests.result_summary: Performance decreased >50% in dichotic condition compared to monotic; scores well below normal limits.

tests.name: Two-Pair Dichotic Digits (TPDD)
tests.result_summary: Scores below normal limits; performance did not differ between dichotic and monotic conditions.

tests.name: Frequency Pattern (FP)
tests.result_summary: Ability to follow patterns decreased >40% when labeling (linguistic) vs humming (non-linguistic).

proposed_items: Return to work in a modified role as an 'IT support officer' rather than help desk operator.
Work in a quiet laboratory environment.
Solve client IT problems offline in a serial manner (one at a time).
Use assistive listening devices, specifically a wireless headset connected to phone and computer.
CAPD intervention/rehabilitation program with the audiologist.
counseling_actions: Explain that hearing tests confirm permanent high-frequency hearing loss.
Discuss how processing tests show significant difficulty with background noise and multitasking.
Advise that the previous noisy help desk role would be extremely difficult and frustrating.
Recommend slowing down the rate of information flow in conversations.
Counsel on the use of the wireless headset to improve signal-to-noise ratio.

escalation.rationale_short: Report functional findings to the social worker to guide return-to-work planning and job role modification.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor functional status in the new work role and continue rehabilitation programs.

expected_outcome: Patient successfully returned to work as an IT support officer (modified role).
Patient was able to work in a quiet laboratory solving problems serially.
Patient used a wireless headset to connect to phones, computers, and a roving microphone.
Patient continued with rehabilitation programs, including CAPD intervention.
Patient continues to recover from TBI slowly but steadily.
